TopicTitle: White Owl's video series discussion thread

Articles.Content: add a crewtank to Valkyrie so you can bring the poor kerbal home
What a brilliant use of the orbital construction mod! I never would have thought of that way to bring up a craft previously constructed.

Nice video. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

One thing I noticed is that you\'re launching your Valkyrie from the runway. You can actually launch spacecraft constructed in the SPH from the launch pad if you want. Just copy the .craft file from the SPH folder to the VAB folder, load it up in the VAB, rotate it so that it stands vertically, and you\'re ready to go.

Hey White/Winter,

I just want to say I\'ve recently discovered your vids and have been watching them and enjoying them. You\'ve actually convinced me to take a look at some of the planes I\'ve been building and take a more analytical approach rather than just throwing stuff together, seeing what works, and tweaking it through trial and error, along with teaching me a few things.

Anyway, I have a question/request.

I notice that you use .cfg edited wing connectors, delta, and structural wings (and it seems the hardpoints or pylons?) so you have larger variants of the parts. I\'ve downloaded and have been toying with the rescaled plane parts mod/edit where the creator just made increasing sizes of swept wings. I\'m happy with those but would like the same for the other 'basic' plane wing parts.

Would you mind either, A: releasing the .cfg edits you did to rescale the parts, or B: let me in on what kind of math you used to arrive at your figures? I could just scale them up, but I\'d want the weights and lift/drag to be at least somewhat realistic in terms of their counterparts.

Thanks in advance, and keep up the good work.

> 
> Love your vids. Don\'t have a youtube though, otherwise you would have one more subscriber ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
> 
> Anyway thanks for the list. I had been looking for your Junebug SRB engine for ages.

 I was looking for it forever too haha, it is the small srb from Sunday punch\'s old wobbly rockets pack.

> 
> Nice video. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
> 
> One thing I noticed is that you\'re launching your Valkyrie from the runway. You can actually launch spacecraft constructed in the SPH from the launch pad if you want. Just copy the .craft file from the SPH folder to the VAB folder, load it up in the VAB, rotate it so that it stands vertically, and you\'re ready to go.

He usually launches it vertically from the runway. It allows him to bypass that step, plus there\'s no launch tower to crash into off the bat.

> 
> Would you mind either, A: releasing the .cfg edits you did to rescale the parts, or B: let me in on what kind of math you used to arrive at your figures? I could just scale them up, but I\'d want the weights and lift/drag to be at least somewhat realistic in terms of their counterparts.

I\'d like them to be somewhat realistic too, but they\'re just a best guess according to what I thought felt right. Really, I\'m hoping some aeronautical engineering types can get us better wing code for this game. But yeah, I\'ll share what I did... just need to stop being lazy about it and actually put a whole package together.

Oh, and I took the black thermal tile texture off one of C7\'s parts, and added it to the tail cone from NovaPunch. Increased the mass to 1 and stuck it on the nose for balance and looks.
hey white owl if u press ctrl+alt+shift+d its a debug console so u can have like cheats and stuff dont have to reply

Hello Owl,

I've build my own space shuttle, based on your design (with the tilting engines en external rocketboosters and some extra fuel tanks). The launch it self goes great, but when I do a re-entry on kerbal, my ship is totaly uncontrolable. Does this has to do with the wings and control surfaces or is this causrf due the tilting engines and other things that I'm not known off. I would realy like your - and others - opinion.

Thanks!
I've been following your video series and the latest seemed to help me a lot in terms of figuring out how to use the orbital construction mod, I was just stumped at how the thing worked haha.
Hey, I really like your youtube series, but I have to ask... Where do you have those big wings from? Haven't found any of them in your used mods.
They're from C7's original pack.

You know white owl i just noticed your from my state! Pretty cool if you ask me two KSP YouTubers from the same state ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
Great videos Matt I really enjoy the crazy but jenius designs. Just one question: Do you use a wiki or something for your planes beacuse they are very complicated (and awesome).
i think your series is great, and looking forward to part 32

Really love the series man. Just dont play kerbal bowling on the mun for success ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
do you know were to download the novapunch remix pack.

> 
> do you know were to download the novapunch remix pack.

NovaPunch is currently unavailable due to licensing issues - Tiberion has to get approval from NovaSilisko, CaptainSlug, and SundayPunch before he can distribute it on these boards.
Apologies for the flame war on the latest episode... it appears Youtube doesn't like it when I comment on your videos!
how long are you suspended for

I think we're getting a bit deprived of videos.

Do you actually have any idea when the next video is coming out?

When Youtube decides that WhiteOwl was not involved in click fraud.

(Click fraud is when you click the advertisements on your video repeatedly or you get someone else to. This makes Youtube give the video owner more money than they should, so they prevent them from releasing more videos while they investigate the issue.)
